content.rendered:
Ongoing Legacy 2020 Capital Project Work

In 2020, residents in the Saratoga Springs City School District approved The Legacy Project, a $129.7 million capital project referendum for improvements and renovations to all eight school buildings and the transportation facility.

Learn more about the ongoing work of The Legacy Project.

Legacy 2025 Capital Project Vote

In May 2025, residents of the Saratoga Springs City School District approved the Legacy 2025 Capital Project, a $142.8 million referendum aimed at districtwide improvements and renovations. This project aligns with the Pathways Vision and continues the district’s commitment to enhancing infrastructure, improving safety and security, and modernizing learning environments across all eight school buildings. 

Learn more about the Legacy 2025 Capital Project.

Legacy Referendum Advisory Committee 

The district is committed to enhancing our educational facilities through long-term planning, and the ongoing legacy capital project represents a significant step in this endeavor. To prepare for the Legacy Capital Project Vote in May 2025, the district formed a Legacy Referendum Advisory Committee. This committee played a crucial role in identifying priorities for the scope of work and making recommendations to the Board of Education. 

Learn more about Legacy Referendum Advisory Committee.
